column4: Whenever I run `sudo apt-get ...`, it immediately dies. I can no longer update/install anything with Synaptic, Aptitude, or apt-get.
What's up with that?
no errors?
It just says "Reading package lists..." and then is killed (for apt-get). If I use Synaptic or Aptitude they just hang indefinitely.
could it be bad mirrors in /etc/apt/sources.list?  I find the canadian ones suck
what mirrors are in /etc/apt/sources.list?  pastebin this file's contents
http://pastebin.com/kNekdC9H
remove the us. part from all those lines so it's http://archive.ubuntu....
Here's what I don't get: this was working literally 30 minutes ago.
I haven't touched this file. Why would changing the sources fix anything?
flaky mirrors maybe?  I've had similar problems, just sharing my solution
then apt-get update after changing
exact same results
it makes sense if the mirror(s) you're using aren't working properly
Is there a way to manually check?
did you try changing the urls like i recommended?
Yep. That's what I meant by "exact same result" earlier.
I didn't change the "security" ones at the bottom, but they don't have us in them.
Flannel: Well, whatever the issue was, it's apparently gone now.
the old "Windows Fix" eh
i haven't used it as thoroughly as the last version, but haven't had any issues, everything "just worked" with this version
I've tweaked the hell out of gnome so it just grabbed all my settings and I don't really see the UI changes.
I assume you're talking about things like the window buttons being on the left, etc.
yeah mostly.  luckily it's easy to change such things
